Key Match Events: Jesse Winker hit a one-out double in the ninth off Justin Martinez
Tyrone Taylor entered as a pinch runner
Geraldo Perdomo deflected Jose Iglesias' hard grounder in the ninth
Jose Iglesias drove in Tyrone Taylor with a base hit in the ninth
Edwin Díaz worked the ninth for his 15th save
Francisco Lindor tied it at 2 with a solo shot in the sixth
Randal Grichuk put the D-backs up 2-1 in the third with a two-run homer
Alonso homered in the second for the Mets
Post-Match Reflections: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza said, 'I know we're good. We're up to the competition.'
Edwin Díaz said, 'This team needs me, so I've got to be ready every single day. I've got to do my job always. Today was a good one, but I just have to keep it going now.'
Diamondbacks manager Torey Lovullo said, 'We had some opportunities offensively to score some runs and couldn't get the big hit. It happens in this game. We've just got to turn the page.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets improved to 6-4 over their last 10 games
All three teams (Orioles, Padres, D-backs) are among MLB's best during that span
Edwin Díaz was aggressive with his fastball, using it on 17 of 18 pitches
Ryne Nelson gave up two runs, both on homers, over 6 1/3 innings
David Peterson had another strong start, surrendering seven hits in seven innings
José Buttó got the win after pitching a scoreless eighth
The Diamondbacks lost a series for just the second time in the past 17 chances
Others: The Mets started a three-game road series against the Chicago White Sox
The Diamondbacks will host the Los Angeles Dodgers for a four-game series starting Friday
